page.title: 05Changes in Linlithgow
page.content: To get the information we interviewed four people: Mr Lawson-the headmaster,Mrs Reville,Mrs Farmer and Mr McMeechan. In the 50's Linlithgow was only a small town but in the 60's things started to change.First the old houses from the Vennel to the Cross were demolished and new council flats were built.Then they started to build new private estates all round Linlithgow. This building continued right through the 70's and is still going on today. "Things are much faster today and there is lots more to do,"said Mrs Reville, comparing life in the 50's to life today. Mr McMeechan commented,"Linlithgow is a very nice town,steeped in history and it is a nice clean place to live in."
